Authors:
Peli Amira, Abdullah Noorlidah, Yee Shin Tan, Daniel L.
Lindner, Musa Yusoff, Sabaratnam Vikineswary
Title:
Molecular analysis of Protohydnum sclerodontium in Malaysia
and reassessment of classification to Tremellacantha sclerodontia
Keywords:
fungi, Protohydnum sclerodontium, Tremellacanthaceae,
Tremellacantha sclerodontia, Internal Transcribed Spacer region
Abstract:
The current classification has placed Protohydnum in
Exidiaceae which comprises of gelatinous basidiomes. The specimens of
these fungi exhibit a dried texture on its own basidiomata, although
they are classified under gelatinous fruiting body. This draws an
interest to investigate the classification of these unique fungi using
taxonomic and molecular analyses. The sequences of internal transcribed
spacer (ITS) regions revealed that P. sclerodontium is excluded from its
current Exidiaceae family. The phylogenetic analyses supported the
monophyly of P. sclerodontium and conclude that this species should be
placed in the family of Tremellacanthaceae JÃ¼lich fam. nov based on the
phylogenetic analysis of ITS regions.

trees.title: ML analysis of ITS region for P. sclerodontium
